source: South Carolina Department of Veterans Affairs and national 211 network

resources.name: South Carolina Department of Veterans Affairs
resources.address: South Carolina Department of Veterans Affairs
resources.description: State agency providing comprehensive veteran benefits counseling, disability compensation assistance, housing programs, and employment support services.

resources.name: 2-1-1 South Carolina Information and Referral Service
resources.description: Free, confidential helpline connecting veterans to community resources including housing, employment, food, legal aid, mental health services, and benefits assistance.

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line - National Support
resources.description: 24/7 confidential crisis support for veterans. Free support 365 days a year from qualified professionals. No VA enrollment required.

resources.name: Veterans of Foreign Wars - South Carolina Posts
resources.description: VFW membership organization providing VA claims assistance, financial grants, mental wellness support, and community programs. Accredited service officers offer free assistance.

resources.name: American Legion - South Carolina Department
resources.description: National veteran service organization offering member benefits, community support, youth programs, and connections to state and federal benefits.

resources.name: VA Benefits Administration - South Carolina Region
resources.address: Regional VA offices throughout South Carolina
resources.description: Federal VA providing disability compensation, pension programs, GI Bill education, home loan assistance, vocational rehabilitation, and employment services.

resources.name: Volunteers of America - Southeast
resources.description: National nonprofit with Southeast presence providing mental health services, affordable housing, community outreach, and veteran support programs.

resources.name: Operation Homefront - Military and Veteran Family Support
resources.description: National nonprofit providing emergency financial assistance for military and veteran families. Covers rent, utilities, food, and healthcare assistance.

resources.name: Military Officers Association of America (MOAA)
resources.description: Organization for military officers and families offering benefits guidance, career transition assistance, financial planning, and exclusive member benefits.

resources.name: VetsinTech - Veteran Technology Education and Employment
resources.description: 501(c)(3) nonprofit connecting veterans with technology education, employment, and entrepreneurship opportunities.
